summary: The IRS relies extensively on its IT systems to collect taxes and distribute refunds. However, much of its IT infrastructure is outdated, which can increase cybersecurity risks, staffing issues, and costs. As of August 2022, the IRS had 21 modernization initiatives, including 9 to replace its outdated IT systems. However, 6 of those 9 initiatives did not specify how they would dispose of outdated systems—a...
title: Information Technology: IRS Needs to Complete Modernization Plans and Fully Address Cloud Computing Requirements
